reused_details.reused: (Bloomberg) -- Russia may cut its oil production in response to the G-7 cap on the price of its crude, President Vladimir Putin said.
reused_by_aic: On Friday, Russian President Vladimir Putin said his nation is eyeing a cut to crude oil production in response to the Group of Seven Nations (G7) price cap on Russian crude, Bloomberg reported Friday.

Putin told reporters on Russian state TV that Russia will consider cutting production due to the price cap and added that he would soon announce a presidential decree to further respond to G7s move, according to Bloomberg.

reused_details.reused: The Group of Seven major powers, the European Union and Australia last week agreed to a $60 per barrel price cap on Russian seaborne crude oil after EU members overcame resistance from Poland.
